newsitem.title: SYRIA: Assad discuss Mideast peace with Austrian leader.
newsitem.headline: Assad discuss Mideast peace with Austrian leader.

text.p: Syrian President Hafez al-Assad discussed on Tuesday the Middle East peace process with the head of the Austrian parliament Heinz Fischer.

Official sources said the talks, which were attended by the head of the Syrian People's Assembly (parliament) Abdul-Qadir Qaddoura, also tackled "the obstacles that the current Israeli government places before the peace process."
Fischer told reporters on arrival on Monday that Austria was interested in achieving peace in the Middle East.

Syria accuses Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of reneging on agreements with the previous Labour government. Talks are stalled over the exact fate of the Golan Heights, which Israel captured from Syria in the 1967 Middle East war.
